brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about a warning inspection in JetBrains that reports if an argNames attribute is not defined in an @AspectJ annotation. It is recommended to define argNames attributes in @AspectJ annotations because the method parameter names may not be available at runtime.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'argNames_not_defined' checks all classes and their methods. If a method has an @AspectJ annotation, it asserts that the method has an 'argNames' attribute. If the 'argNames' attribute is not present, it generates a warning message indicating that the 'argNames' attribute is not defined in the @AspectJ annotation for the specific method of the class.
PRE_model_validation: The rule is syntactically correct and follows the RSL syntax. It uses only the built-in functions provided, such as getClasses, getMethods, hasAnnotation, hasAnnoAttr, getName, and getFQN. The rule checks for the existence of the 'argNames' attribute in @AspectJ annotations in all methods of all classes, which aligns with the requirement specified in the JetBrains source URL.
